        Parameters:
        cycle - the cycle
        epoch - an epoch offset as the number of number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT
        createIfAbsent - create missing stores if true, or return null if missing
        Returns:

      • nextCycle

        int nextCycle(int currentCycle,
              @NotNull
              @NotNull TailerDirection direction)
       throws ParseException
        the next available cycle, no cycle will be created by this method, this method is typically used by a tailer to jump to the next cycle when the cycles are not adjacent.
        Parameters:
        currentCycle - the current cycle
        direction - the direction
        Returns:
        the next available cycle from the current cycle, or -1 if there is no next cycle
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • countExcerpts

        long countExcerpts(long fromIndex,
                   long toIndex)
        The number of excerpts between the indexes, fromIndex inclusive, toIndex exclusive.

        When fromIndex and toIndex are in different cycles which are not adjacent, this operation can be expensive, as the index count for each intermediate cycle has to be found and calculated. As such, and in this situation, it's not recommended to call this method regularly in latency sensitive systems.

        Parameters:
        fromIndex - from index, the index provided must exist. To improve performance no checking is carried out to validate if an excerpt exists at this index. ( inclusive )
        toIndex - to index, the index provided must exist. To improve performance no checking is carried out to validate if an excerpt exists at this index. ( exclusive )
        Returns:
        the number of excerpts between the indexes, index1 inclusive, index2 exclusive.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the cycle of fromIndex or toIndex can not be ascertained

      • cycle

        int cycle()
        Returns:
        the current cycle

      • indexCount

        int indexCount()
        Returns:
        the max size of each index and also the number number of index arrays. indexCount^2 is the maximum number of index queue entries.

      • indexSpacing

        int indexSpacing()
        Returns:
        the spacing between indexed entries. If 1 then every entry is indexed.

      • deltaCheckpointInterval

        int deltaCheckpointInterval()
        Description copied from interface: ChronicleQueue
        Returns the Delta Checkpoint Interval for this ChronicleQueue.

        The value returned is always a power of two.

        Specified by:
        deltaCheckpointInterval in interface ChronicleQueue
        Returns:
        the checkpointInterval used by delta wire
